description: Use the browser.privacy API to control usage of the features in the browser that can affect a user's privacy.

types.description: The IP handling policy of WebRTC.
An object which describes TLS minimum and maximum versions.
The mode for https-only mode.

networkPredictionEnabled.description: If enabled, the browser attempts to speed up your web browsing experience by pre-resolving DNS entries, prerendering sites (<link rel='prefetch' ...>), and preemptively opening TCP and SSL connections to servers. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

peerConnectionEnabled.description: Allow users to enable and disable RTCPeerConnections (aka WebRTC).

webRTCIPHandlingPolicy.description: Allow users to specify the media performance/privacy tradeoffs which impacts how WebRTC traffic will be routed and how much local address information is exposed. This preference's value is of type IPHandlingPolicy, defaulting to default.

tlsVersionRestriction.description: This property controls the minimum and maximum TLS versions. This setting's value is an object of $(ref:tlsVersionRestrictionConfig).

httpsOnlyMode.description: Allow users to query the mode for 'HTTPS-Only Mode'. This setting's value is of type HTTPSOnlyModeOption, defaulting to never.

description: Use the browser.privacy API to control usage of the features in the browser that can affect a user's privacy.

passwordSavingEnabled.description: If enabled, the password manager will ask if you want to save passwords. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

description: Use the browser.privacy API to control usage of the features in the browser that can affect a user's privacy.

types.description: The mode for tracking protection.
The settings for cookies.

behavior.description: The type of cookies to allow.

nonPersistentCookies.description: Whether to create all cookies as nonPersistent (i.e., session) cookies.

thirdPartyCookiesAllowed.description: If disabled, the browser blocks third-party sites from setting cookies. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

hyperlinkAuditingEnabled.description: If enabled, the browser sends auditing pings when requested by a website (<a ping>). The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

referrersEnabled.description: If enabled, the browser sends referer headers with your requests. Yes, the name of this preference doesn't match the misspelled header. No, we're not going to change it. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

resistFingerprinting.description: If enabled, the browser attempts to appear similar to other users by reporting generic information to websites. This can prevent websites from uniquely identifying users. Examples of data that is spoofed include number of CPU cores, precision of JavaScript timers, the local timezone, and disabling features such as GamePad support, and the WebSpeech and Navigator APIs. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is false.

firstPartyIsolate.description: If enabled, the browser will associate all data (including cookies, HSTS data, cached images, and more) for any third party domains with the domain in the address bar. This prevents third party trackers from using directly stored information to identify you across different websites, but may break websites where you login with a third party account (such as a Facebook or Google login.) The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is false.

protectedContentEnabled.description: Available on Windows and ChromeOS only: If enabled, the browser provides a unique ID to plugins in order to run protected content. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

trackingProtectionMode.description: Allow users to specify the mode for tracking protection. This setting's value is of type TrackingProtectionModeOption, defaulting to private_browsing_only.

cookieConfig.description: Allow users to specify the default settings for allowing cookies, as well as whether all cookies should be created as non-persistent cookies. This setting's value is of type CookieConfig.

description: Provides access to global proxy settings for Firefox and proxy event listeners to handle dynamic proxy implementations.

types.description: An object which describes proxy settings.

proxyType.description: The type of proxy to use.

http.description: The address of the http proxy, can include a port.

httpProxyAll.description: Use the http proxy server for all protocols.

ftp.description: The address of the ftp proxy, can include a port.

ssl.description: The address of the ssl proxy, can include a port.

socks.description: The address of the socks proxy, can include a port.

socksVersion.description: The version of the socks proxy.

passthrough.description: A list of hosts which should not be proxied.

autoConfigUrl.description: A URL to use to configure the proxy.

autoLogin.description: Do not prompt for authentication if password is saved.

proxyDNS.description: Proxy DNS when using SOCKS v5.

respectBeConservative.description: If true (the default value), do not use newer TLS protocol features that might have interoperability problems on the Internet. This is intended only for use with critical infrastructure like the updates, and is only available to privileged addons.

settings.description: Configures proxy settings. This setting's value is an object of type ProxyConfig.

events.name: onRequest
events.description: Fired when proxy data is needed for a request.

requestId.description: The ID of the request. Request IDs are unique within a browser session. As a result, they could be used to relate different events of the same request.

frameId.description: The value 0 indicates that the request happens in the main frame; a positive value indicates the ID of a subframe in which the request happens. If the document of a (sub-)frame is loaded (type is main_frame or sub_frame), frameId indicates the ID of this frame, not the ID of the outer frame. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

parentFrameId.description: ID of frame that wraps the frame which sent the request. Set to -1 if no parent frame exists.

cookieStoreId.description: The cookie store ID of the contextual identity.

originUrl.description: URL of the resource that triggered this request.

documentUrl.description: URL of the page into which the requested resource will be loaded.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the request takes place. Set to -1 if the request isn't related to a tab.

type.description: How the requested resource will be used.

timeStamp.description: The time when this signal is triggered, in milliseconds since the epoch.

fromCache.description: Indicates if this response was fetched from disk cache.

requestHeaders.description: The HTTP request headers that are going to be sent out with this request.

urlClassification.description: Url classification if the request has been classified.

thirdParty.description: Indicates if this request and its content window hierarchy is third party.

extraParameters.name: filter
extraParameters.description: A set of filters that restricts the events that will be sent to this listener.

extraParameters.name: extraInfoSpec
extraParameters.description: Array of extra information that should be passed to the listener function.

events.name: onError
events.description: Notifies about errors caused by the invalid use of the proxy API.

description: Use the browser.runtime API to retrieve the background page, return details about the manifest, and listen for and respond to events in the app or extension lifecycle. You can also use this API to convert the relative path of URLs to fully-qualified URLs.

types.description: An object which allows two way communication with other pages.

sender.description: This property will only be present on ports passed to onConnect/onConnectExternal listeners.

types.description: An object containing information about the script context that sent a message or request.

tab.description: The $(ref:tabs.Tab) which opened the connection, if any. This property will only be present when the connection was opened from a tab (including content scripts), and only if the receiver is an extension, not an app.

frameId.description: The $(topic:frame_ids)[frame] that opened the connection. 0 for top-level frames, positive for child frames. This will only be set when tab is set.

id.description: The ID of the extension or app that opened the connection, if any.

url.description: The URL of the page or frame that opened the connection. If the sender is in an iframe, it will be iframe's URL not the URL of the page which hosts it.

tlsChannelId.description: The TLS channel ID of the page or frame that opened the connection, if requested by the extension or app, and if available.

types.description: The operating system the browser is running on.
The machine's processor architecture.
An object containing information about the current platform.

os.description: The operating system the browser is running on.

nacl_arch.description: The native client architecture. This may be different from arch on some platforms.

types.description: An object containing information about the current browser.

name.description: The name of the browser, for example 'Firefox'.

vendor.description: The name of the browser vendor, for example 'Mozilla'.

version.description: The browser's version, for example '42.0.0' or '0.8.1pre'.

buildID.description: The browser's build ID/date, for example '20160101'.

types.description: Result of the update check.
The reason that this event is being dispatched.

The reason that the event is being dispatched. 'app_update' is used when the restart is needed because the application is updated to a newer version. 'os_update' is used when the restart is needed because the browser/OS is updated to a newer version. 'periodic' is used when the system runs for more than the permitted uptime set in the enterprise policy.

lastError.description: This will be defined during an API method callback if there was an error

message.description: Details about the error which occurred.

functions.name: getBackgroundPage
functions.description: Retrieves the JavaScript 'window' object for the background page running inside the current extension/app. If the background page is an event page, the system will ensure it is loaded before calling the callback. If there is no background page, an error is set.

parameters.name: backgroundPage
parameters.description: The JavaScript 'window' object for the background page.

functions.name: openOptionsPage
functions.description:
Open your Extension's options page, if possible.

The precise behavior may depend on your manifest's $(topic:optionsV2)[options_ui] or $(topic:options)[options_page] key, or what the browser happens to support at the time.

If your Extension does not declare an options page, or the browser failed to create one for some other reason, the callback will set $(ref:lastError).

functions.name: getManifest
functions.description: Returns details about the app or extension from the manifest. The object returned is a serialization of the full $(topic:manifest)[manifest file].

functions.name: getURL
functions.description: Converts a relative path within an app/extension install directory to a fully-qualified URL.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: A path to a resource within an app/extension expressed relative to its install directory.

returns.description: The fully-qualified URL to the resource.

functions.name: setUninstallURL
functions.description: Sets the URL to be visited upon uninstallation. This may be used to clean up server-side data, do analytics, and implement surveys. Maximum 255 characters.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL to be opened after the extension is uninstalled. This URL must have an http: or https: scheme. Set an empty string to not open a new tab upon uninstallation.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when the uninstall URL is set. If the given URL is invalid, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set.

functions.name: reload
functions.description: Reloads the app or extension.

functions.name: requestUpdateCheck
functions.description: Requests an update check for this app/extension.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Result of the update check.

parameters.name: details

version.description: The version of the available update.

parameters.description: If an update is available, this contains more information about the available update.

functions.name: restart
functions.description: Restart the device when the app runs in kiosk mode. Otherwise, it's no-op.

functions.name: connect
functions.description: Attempts to connect to connect listeners within an extension/app (such as the background page), or other extensions/apps. This is useful for content scripts connecting to their extension processes, inter-app/extension communication, and $(topic:manifest/externally_connectable)[web messaging]. Note that this does not connect to any listeners in a content script. Extensions may connect to content scripts embedded in tabs via $(ref:tabs.connect).

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: The ID of the extension or app to connect to. If omitted, a connection will be attempted with your own extension. Required if sending messages from a web page for $(topic:manifest/externally_connectable)[web messaging].

name.description: Will be passed into onConnect for processes that are listening for the connection event.

includeTlsChannelId.description: Whether the TLS channel ID will be passed into onConnectExternal for processes that are listening for the connection event.

returns.description: Port through which messages can be sent and received. The port's $(ref:runtime.Port onDisconnect) event is fired if the extension/app does not exist.

functions.name: connectNative
functions.description: Connects to a native application in the host machine.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: The name of the registered application to connect to.

returns.description: Port through which messages can be sent and received with the application

functions.name: sendMessage
functions.description: Sends a single message to event listeners within your extension/app or a different extension/app. Similar to $(ref:runtime.connect) but only sends a single message, with an optional response. If sending to your extension, the $(ref:runtime.onMessage) event will be fired in each page, or $(ref:runtime.onMessageExternal), if a different extension. Note that extensions cannot send messages to content scripts using this method. To send messages to content scripts, use $(ref:tabs.sendMessage).

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: The ID of the extension/app to send the message to. If omitted, the message will be sent to your own extension/app. Required if sending messages from a web page for $(topic:manifest/externally_connectable)[web messaging].

includeTlsChannelId.description: Whether the TLS channel ID will be passed into onMessageExternal for processes that are listening for the connection event.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The JSON response object sent by the handler of the message. If an error occurs while connecting to the extension, the callback will be called with no arguments and $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set to the error message.

functions.name: sendNativeMessage
functions.description: Send a single message to a native application.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: The name of the native messaging host.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message that will be passed to the native messaging host.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The response message sent by the native messaging host. If an error occurs while connecting to the native messaging host, the callback will be called with no arguments and $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set to the error message.

functions.name: getBrowserInfo
functions.description: Returns information about the current browser.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called with results

functions.name: getPlatformInfo
functions.description: Returns information about the current platform.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called with results

functions.name: getPackageDirectoryEntry
functions.description: Returns a DirectoryEntry for the package directory.

events.name: onStartup
events.description: Fired when a profile that has this extension installed first starts up. This event is not fired for incognito profiles.

events.name: onInstalled
events.description: Fired when the extension is first installed, when the extension is updated to a new version, and when the browser is updated to a new version.

reason.description: The reason that this event is being dispatched.

previousVersion.description: Indicates the previous version of the extension, which has just been updated. This is present only if 'reason' is 'update'.

temporary.description: Indicates whether the addon is installed as a temporary extension.

id.description: Indicates the ID of the imported shared module extension which updated. This is present only if 'reason' is 'shared_module_update'.

events.name: onSuspend
events.description: Sent to the event page just before it is unloaded. This gives the extension opportunity to do some clean up. Note that since the page is unloading, any asynchronous operations started while handling this event are not guaranteed to complete. If more activity for the event page occurs before it gets unloaded the onSuspendCanceled event will be sent and the page won't be unloaded.

events.name: onSuspendCanceled
events.description: Sent after onSuspend to indicate that the app won't be unloaded after all.

events.name: onUpdateAvailable
events.description: Fired when an update is available, but isn't installed immediately because the app is currently running. If you do nothing, the update will be installed the next time the background page gets unloaded, if you want it to be installed sooner you can explicitly call $(ref:runtime.reload). If your extension is using a persistent background page, the background page of course never gets unloaded, so unless you call $(ref:runtime.reload) manually in response to this event the update will not get installed until the next time the browser itself restarts. If no handlers are listening for this event, and your extension has a persistent background page, it behaves as if $(ref:runtime.reload) is called in response to this event.

parameters.name: details

version.description: The version number of the available update.

parameters.description: The manifest details of the available update.

events.name: onBrowserUpdateAvailable
events.description: Fired when an update for the browser is available, but isn't installed immediately because a browser restart is required.

events.name: onConnect
events.description: Fired when a connection is made from either an extension process or a content script.

events.name: onConnectExternal
events.description: Fired when a connection is made from another extension.

events.name: onMessage
events.description: Fired when a message is sent from either an extension process or a content script.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message sent by the calling script.

parameters.name: sendResponse
parameters.description: Function to call (at most once) when you have a response. The argument should be any JSON-ifiable object. If you have more than one onMessage listener in the same document, then only one may send a response. This function becomes invalid when the event listener returns, unless you return true from the event listener to indicate you wish to send a response asynchronously (this will keep the message channel open to the other end until sendResponse is called).

returns.description: Return true from the event listener if you wish to call sendResponse after the event listener returns.

events.name: onMessageExternal
events.description: Fired when a message is sent from another extension/app. Cannot be used in a content script.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message sent by the calling script.

parameters.name: sendResponse
parameters.description: Function to call (at most once) when you have a response. The argument should be any JSON-ifiable object. If you have more than one onMessage listener in the same document, then only one may send a response. This function becomes invalid when the event listener returns, unless you return true from the event listener to indicate you wish to send a response asynchronously (this will keep the message channel open to the other end until sendResponse is called).

returns.description: Return true from the event listener if you wish to call sendResponse after the event listener returns.

events.name: onRestartRequired
events.description: Fired when an app or the device that it runs on needs to be restarted. The app should close all its windows at its earliest convenient time to let the restart to happen. If the app does nothing, a restart will be enforced after a 24-hour grace period has passed. Currently, this event is only fired for Chrome OS kiosk apps.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: The reason that the event is being dispatched.

description: Use browser.search to interact with search engines.

types.description: An object encapsulating a search engine

tabId.description: The ID of the tab for the search results. If not specified, a new tab is created.

description: Use the chrome.sessions API to query and restore tabs and windows from a browsing session.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of entries to be fetched in the requested list. Omit this parameter to fetch the maximum number of entries ($(ref:sessions.MAX_SESSION_RESULTS)).

lastModified.description: The time when the window or tab was closed or modified, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

tab.description: The $(ref:tabs.Tab), if this entry describes a tab. Either this or $(ref:sessions.Session.window) will be set.

window.description: The $(ref:windows.Window), if this entry describes a window. Either this or $(ref:sessions.Session.tab) will be set.

deviceName.description: The name of the foreign device.

sessions.description: A list of open window sessions for the foreign device, sorted from most recently to least recently modified session.

functions.name: forgetClosedTab
functions.description: Forget a recently closed tab.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: The windowId of the window to which the recently closed tab to be forgotten belongs.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: The sessionId (closedId) of the recently closed tab to be forgotten.

functions.name: forgetClosedWindow
functions.description: Forget a recently closed window.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: The sessionId (closedId) of the recently closed window to be forgotten.

functions.name: getRecentlyClosed
functions.description: Gets the list of recently closed tabs and/or windows.

parameters.name: sessions
parameters.description: The list of closed entries in reverse order that they were closed (the most recently closed tab or window will be at index 0). The entries may contain either tabs or windows.

functions.name: getDevices
functions.description: Retrieves all devices with synced sessions.

parameters.name: devices
parameters.description: The list of $(ref:sessions.Device) objects for each synced session, sorted in order from device with most recently modified session to device with least recently modified session. $(ref:tabs.Tab) objects are sorted by recency in the $(ref:windows.Window) of the $(ref:sessions.Session) objects.

functions.name: restore

parameters.name: sessionId

parameters.name: restoredSession
parameters.description: A $(ref:sessions.Session) containing the restored $(ref:windows.Window) or $(ref:tabs.Tab) object.

description: Use sidebar actions to add a sidebar to Firefox.

types.description: Pixel data for an image. Must be an ImageData object (for example, from a canvas element).

functions.name: setTitle
functions.description: Sets the title of the sidebar action. This shows up in the tooltip.

title.description: The string the sidebar action should display when moused over.

tabId.description: Sets the sidebar title for the tab specified by tabId. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

windowId.description: Sets the sidebar title for the window specified by windowId.

functions.name: getTitle
functions.description: Gets the title of the sidebar action.

tabId.description: Specify the tab to get the title from. If no tab nor window is specified, the global title is returned.

windowId.description: Specify the window to get the title from. If no tab nor window is specified, the global title is returned.

functions.name: setIcon
functions.description: Sets the icon for the sidebar action. The icon can be specified either as the path to an image file or as the pixel data from a canvas element, or as dictionary of either one of those. Either the path or the imageData property must be specified.

imageData.description: Either an ImageData object or a dictionary {size -> ImageData} representing icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * 19 will be selected. Initially only scales 1 and 2 will be supported. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.imageData = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'19': foo}'

path.description: Either a relative image path or a dictionary {size -> relative image path} pointing to icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * 19 will be selected. Initially only scales 1 and 2 will be supported. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.path = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'19': foo}'

tabId.description: Sets the sidebar icon for the tab specified by tabId. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

windowId.description: Sets the sidebar icon for the window specified by windowId.

functions.name: setPanel
functions.description: Sets the url to the html document to be opened in the sidebar when the user clicks on the sidebar action's icon.

tabId.description: Sets the sidebar url for the tab specified by tabId. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

windowId.description: Sets the sidebar url for the window specified by windowId.

panel.description: The url to the html file to show in a sidebar.  If set to the empty string (''), no sidebar is shown.

functions.name: getPanel
functions.description: Gets the url to the html document set as the panel for this sidebar action.

tabId.description: Specify the tab to get the panel from. If no tab nor window is specified, the global panel is returned.

windowId.description: Specify the window to get the panel from. If no tab nor window is specified, the global panel is returned.

functions.name: open
functions.description: Opens the extension sidebar in the active window.

functions.name: close
functions.description: Closes the extension sidebar in the active window if the sidebar belongs to the extension.

functions.name: toggle
functions.description: Toggles the extension sidebar in the active window.

functions.name: isOpen
functions.description: Checks whether the sidebar action is open.

windowId.description: Specify the window to get the openness from.

description: Use the browser.storage API to store, retrieve, and track changes to user data.

oldValue.description: The old value of the item, if there was an old value.

newValue.description: The new value of the item, if there is a new value.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets one or more items from storage.

parameters.name: keys

choices.description: Storage items to return in the callback, where the values are replaced with those from storage if they exist.

parameters.description: A single key to get, list of keys to get, or a dictionary specifying default values (see description of the object). An empty list or object will return an empty result object. Pass in null to get the entire contents of storage.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback with storage items, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: Object with items in their key-value mappings.

functions.name: getBytesInUse
functions.description: Gets the amount of space (in bytes) being used by one or more items.

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: A single key or list of keys to get the total usage for. An empty list will return 0. Pass in null to get the total usage of all of storage.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback with the amount of space being used by storage, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

parameters.name: bytesInUse
parameters.description: Amount of space being used in storage, in bytes.

functions.name: set
functions.description: Sets multiple items.

parameters.name: items
parameters.description:
An object which gives each key/value pair to update storage with. Any other key/value pairs in storage will not be affected.

Primitive values such as numbers will serialize as expected. Values with a typeof "object" and "function" will typically serialize to {}, with the exception of Array (serializes as expected), Date, and Regex (serialize using their String representation).

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback on success, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes one or more items from storage.

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: A single key or a list of keys for items to remove.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback on success, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Removes all items from storage.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback on success, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets one or more items from storage.

parameters.name: keys

choices.description: Storage items to return in the callback, where the values are replaced with those from storage if they exist.

parameters.description: A single key to get, list of keys to get, or a dictionary specifying default values (see description of the object). An empty list or object will return an empty result object. Pass in null to get the entire contents of storage.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback with storage items, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: Object with items in their key-value mappings.

functions.name: getBytesInUse
functions.description: Gets the amount of space (in bytes) being used by one or more items.

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: A single key or list of keys to get the total usage for. An empty list will return 0. Pass in null to get the total usage of all of storage.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback with the amount of space being used by storage, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

parameters.name: bytesInUse
parameters.description: Amount of space being used in storage, in bytes.

functions.name: set
functions.description: Sets multiple items.

parameters.name: items
parameters.description:
An object which gives each key/value pair to update storage with. Any other key/value pairs in storage will not be affected.

Primitive values such as numbers will serialize as expected. Values with a typeof "object" and "function" will typically serialize to {}, with the exception of Array (serializes as expected), Date, and Regex (serialize using their String representation).

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback on success, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes one or more items from storage.

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: A single key or a list of keys for items to remove.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback on success, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Removes all items from storage.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback on success, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

events.name: onChanged
events.description: Fired when one or more items change.

parameters.name: changes
parameters.description: Object mapping each key that changed to its corresponding $(ref:storage.StorageChange) for that item.

parameters.name: areaName
parameters.description: The name of the storage area ("sync", "local" or "managed") the changes are for.

sync.description: Items in the sync storage area are synced by the browser.

QUOTA_BYTES.description: The maximum total amount (in bytes) of data that can be stored in sync storage, as measured by the JSON stringification of every value plus every key's length. Updates that would cause this limit to be exceeded fail immediately and set $(ref:runtime.lastError).

QUOTA_BYTES_PER_ITEM.description: The maximum size (in bytes) of each individual item in sync storage, as measured by the JSON stringification of its value plus its key length. Updates containing items larger than this limit will fail immediately and set $(ref:runtime.lastError).

MAX_ITEMS.description: The maximum number of items that can be stored in sync storage. Updates that would cause this limit to be exceeded will fail immediately and set $(ref:runtime.lastError).

MAX_WRITE_OPERATIONS_PER_HOUR.description:
The maximum number of set, remove, or clear operations that can be performed each hour. This is 1 every 2 seconds, a lower ceiling than the short term higher writes-per-minute limit.

Updates that would cause this limit to be exceeded fail immediately and set $(ref:runtime.lastError).

MAX_WRITE_OPERATIONS_PER_MINUTE.description:
The maximum number of set, remove, or clear operations that can be performed each minute. This is 2 per second, providing higher throughput than writes-per-hour over a shorter period of time.

Updates that would cause this limit to be exceeded fail immediately and set $(ref:runtime.lastError).

MAX_SUSTAINED_WRITE_OPERATIONS_PER_MINUT.deprecated: The storage.sync API no longer has a sustained write operation quota.

local.description: Items in the local storage area are local to each machine.

QUOTA_BYTES.description: The maximum amount (in bytes) of data that can be stored in local storage, as measured by the JSON stringification of every value plus every key's length. This value will be ignored if the extension has the unlimitedStorage permission. Updates that would cause this limit to be exceeded fail immediately and set $(ref:runtime.lastError).

managed.description: Items in the managed storage area are set by administrators or native applications, and are read-only for the extension; trying to modify this namespace results in an error.

QUOTA_BYTES.description: The maximum size (in bytes) of the managed storage JSON manifest file. Files larger than this limit will fail to load.

description: Use the browser.tabs API to interact with the browser's tab system. You can use this API to create, modify, and rearrange tabs in the browser.

types.description: An event that caused a muted state change.

enum.name: user
enum.description: A user input action has set/overridden the muted state.

enum.name: capture
enum.description: Tab capture started, forcing a muted state change.

enum.name: extension
enum.description: An extension, identified by the extensionId field, set the muted state.

types.description: Tab muted state and the reason for the last state change.

muted.description: Whether the tab is prevented from playing sound (but hasn't necessarily recently produced sound). Equivalent to whether the muted audio indicator is showing.

reason.description: The reason the tab was muted or unmuted. Not set if the tab's mute state has never been changed.

extensionId.description: The ID of the extension that changed the muted state. Not set if an extension was not the reason the muted state last changed.

types.description: Tab sharing state for screen, microphone and camera.

screen.description: If the tab is sharing the screen the value will be one of "Screen", "Window", or "Application", or undefined if not screen sharing.

camera.description: True if the tab is using the camera.

microphone.description: True if the tab is using the microphone.

id.description: The ID of the tab. Tab IDs are unique within a browser session. Under some circumstances a Tab may not be assigned an ID, for example when querying foreign tabs using the $(ref:sessions) API, in which case a session ID may be present. Tab ID can also be set to $(ref:tabs.TAB_ID_NONE) for apps and devtools windows.

index.description: The zero-based index of the tab within its window.

windowId.description: The ID of the window the tab is contained within.

openerTabId.description: The ID of the tab that opened this tab, if any. This property is only present if the opener tab still exists.

highlighted.description: Whether the tab is highlighted. Works as an alias of active

active.description: Whether the tab is active in its window. (Does not necessarily mean the window is focused.)

lastAccessed.description: The last time the tab was accessed as the number of milliseconds since epoch.

audible.description: Whether the tab has produced sound over the past couple of seconds (but it might not be heard if also muted). Equivalent to whether the speaker audio indicator is showing.

mutedInfo.description: Current tab muted state and the reason for the last state change.

url.description: The URL the tab is displaying. This property is only present if the extension's manifest includes the "tabs" permission.

title.description: The title of the tab. This property is only present if the extension's manifest includes the "tabs" permission.

favIconUrl.description: The URL of the tab's favicon. This property is only present if the extension's manifest includes the "tabs" permission. It may also be an empty string if the tab is loading.

discarded.description: True while the tab is not loaded with content.

incognito.description: Whether the tab is in an incognito window.

width.description: The width of the tab in pixels.

height.description: The height of the tab in pixels.

hidden.description: True if the tab is hidden.

sessionId.description: The session ID used to uniquely identify a Tab obtained from the $(ref:sessions) API.

cookieStoreId.description: The CookieStoreId used for the tab.

isArticle.description: Whether the document in the tab can be rendered in reader mode.

isInReaderMode.description: Whether the document in the tab is being rendered in reader mode.

sharingState.description: Current tab sharing state for screen, microphone and camera.

attention.description: Whether the tab is drawing attention.

successorTabId.description: The ID of this tab's successor, if any; $(ref:tabs.TAB_ID_NONE) otherwise.

types.description: Defines how zoom changes are handled, i.e. which entity is responsible for the actual scaling of the page; defaults to automatic.

enum.name: automatic
enum.description: Zoom changes are handled automatically by the browser.

enum.name: manual
enum.description: Overrides the automatic handling of zoom changes. The onZoomChange event will still be dispatched, and it is the responsibility of the extension to listen for this event and manually scale the page. This mode does not support per-origin zooming, and will thus ignore the scope zoom setting and assume per-tab.

enum.name: disabled
enum.description: Disables all zooming in the tab. The tab will revert to the default zoom level, and all attempted zoom changes will be ignored.

types.description: Defines whether zoom changes will persist for the page's origin, or only take effect in this tab; defaults to per-origin when in automatic mode, and per-tab otherwise.

enum.name: per-origin
enum.description: Zoom changes will persist in the zoomed page's origin, i.e. all other tabs navigated to that same origin will be zoomed as well. Moreover, per-origin zoom changes are saved with the origin, meaning that when navigating to other pages in the same origin, they will all be zoomed to the same zoom factor. The per-origin scope is only available in the automatic mode.

enum.name: per-tab
enum.description: Zoom changes only take effect in this tab, and zoom changes in other tabs will not affect the zooming of this tab. Also, per-tab zoom changes are reset on navigation; navigating a tab will always load pages with their per-origin zoom factors.

types.description: Defines how zoom changes in a tab are handled and at what scope.

mode.description: Defines how zoom changes are handled, i.e. which entity is responsible for the actual scaling of the page; defaults to automatic.

scope.description: Defines whether zoom changes will persist for the page's origin, or only take effect in this tab; defaults to per-origin when in automatic mode, and per-tab otherwise.

defaultZoomFactor.description: Used to return the default zoom level for the current tab in calls to tabs.getZoomSettings.

types.description: Defines the page settings to be used when saving a page as a pdf file.

toFileName.description: The name of the file. May include optional .pdf extension.

paperSizeUnit.description: The page size unit: 0 = inches, 1 = millimeters. Default: 0.

paperWidth.description: The paper width in paper size units. Default: 8.5.

paperHeight.description: The paper height in paper size units. Default: 11.0.

orientation.description: The page content orientation: 0 = portrait, 1 = landscape. Default: 0.

scaling.description: The page content scaling factor: 1.0 = 100% = normal size. Default: 1.0.

shrinkToFit.description: Whether the page content should shrink to fit the page width (overrides scaling). Default: true.

showBackgroundColors.description: Whether the page background colors should be shown. Default: false.

showBackgroundImages.description: Whether the page background images should be shown. Default: false.

edgeLeft.description: The spacing between the left header/footer and the left edge of the paper (inches). Default: 0.

edgeRight.description: The spacing between the right header/footer and the right edge of the paper (inches). Default: 0.

edgeTop.description: The spacing between the top of the headers and the top edge of the paper (inches). Default: 0

edgeBottom.description: The spacing between the bottom of the footers and the bottom edge of the paper (inches). Default: 0.

marginLeft.description: The margin between the page content and the left edge of the paper (inches). Default: 0.5.

marginRight.description: The margin between the page content and the right edge of the paper (inches). Default: 0.5.

marginTop.description: The margin between the page content and the top edge of the paper (inches). Default: 0.5.

marginBottom.description: The margin between the page content and the bottom edge of the paper (inches). Default: 0.5.

headerLeft.description: The text for the page's left header. Default: '&T'.

headerCenter.description: The text for the page's center header. Default: ''.

headerRight.description: The text for the page's right header. Default: '&U'.

footerLeft.description: The text for the page's left footer. Default: '&PT'.

footerCenter.description: The text for the page's center footer. Default: ''.

footerRight.description: The text for the page's right footer. Default: '&D'.

types.description: Whether the tabs have completed loading.
The type of window.
Event names supported in onUpdated.
An object describing filters to apply to tabs.onUpdated events.

urls.description: A list of URLs or URL patterns. Events that cannot match any of the URLs will be filtered out. Filtering with urls requires the "tabs" or "activeTab" permission.

properties.description: A list of property names. Events that do not match any of the names will be filtered out.

TAB_ID_NONE.description: An ID which represents the absence of a browser tab.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Retrieves details about the specified tab.

functions.name: getCurrent
functions.description: Gets the tab that this script call is being made from. May be undefined if called from a non-tab context (for example: a background page or popup view).

functions.name: connect
functions.description: Connects to the content script(s) in the specified tab. The $(ref:runtime.onConnect) event is fired in each content script running in the specified tab for the current extension. For more details, see $(topic:messaging)[Content Script Messaging].

name.description: Will be passed into onConnect for content scripts that are listening for the connection event.

frameId.description: Open a port to a specific $(topic:frame_ids)[frame] identified by frameId instead of all frames in the tab.

returns.description: A port that can be used to communicate with the content scripts running in the specified tab. The port's $(ref:runtime.Port) event is fired if the tab closes or does not exist.

functions.name: sendRequest
functions.description: Sends a single request to the content script(s) in the specified tab, with an optional callback to run when a response is sent back.  The $(ref:extension.onRequest) event is fired in each content script running in the specified tab for the current extension.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The JSON response object sent by the handler of the request. If an error occurs while connecting to the specified tab, the callback will be called with no arguments and $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set to the error message.

functions.name: sendMessage
functions.description: Sends a single message to the content script(s) in the specified tab, with an optional callback to run when a response is sent back.  The $(ref:runtime.onMessage) event is fired in each content script running in the specified tab for the current extension.

frameId.description: Send a message to a specific $(topic:frame_ids)[frame] identified by frameId instead of all frames in the tab.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The JSON response object sent by the handler of the message. If an error occurs while connecting to the specified tab, the callback will be called with no arguments and $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set to the error message.

functions.name: getSelected
functions.description: Gets the tab that is selected in the specified window.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: Defaults to the $(topic:current-window)[current window].

functions.name: getAllInWindow
functions.description: Gets details about all tabs in the specified window.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: Defaults to the $(topic:current-window)[current window].

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a new tab.

windowId.description: The window to create the new tab in. Defaults to the $(topic:current-window)[current window].

index.description: The position the tab should take in the window. The provided value will be clamped to between zero and the number of tabs in the window.

url.description: The URL to navigate the tab to initially. Fully-qualified URLs must include a scheme (i.e. 'http://www.google.com', not 'www.google.com'). Relative URLs will be relative to the current page within the extension. Defaults to the New Tab Page.

active.description: Whether the tab should become the active tab in the window. Does not affect whether the window is focused (see $(ref:windows.update)). Defaults to <var>true</var>.

selected.description: Whether the tab should become the selected tab in the window. Defaults to <var>true</var>

pinned.description: Whether the tab should be pinned. Defaults to <var>false</var>

openerTabId.description: The ID of the tab that opened this tab. If specified, the opener tab must be in the same window as the newly created tab.

cookieStoreId.description: The CookieStoreId for the tab that opened this tab.

openInReaderMode.description: Whether the document in the tab should be opened in reader mode.

discarded.description: Whether the tab is marked as 'discarded' when created.

title.description: The title used for display if the tab is created in discarded mode.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Details about the created tab. Will contain the ID of the new tab.

functions.name: duplicate
functions.description: Duplicates a tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab which is to be duplicated.

index.description: The position the new tab should take in the window. The provided value will be clamped to between zero and the number of tabs in the window.

active.description: Whether the tab should become the active tab in the window. Does not affect whether the window is focused (see $(ref:windows.update)). Defaults to <var>true</var>.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Details about the duplicated tab. The $(ref:tabs.Tab) object doesn't contain url, title and favIconUrl if the "tabs" permission has not been requested.

functions.name: query
functions.description: Gets all tabs that have the specified properties, or all tabs if no properties are specified.

active.description: Whether the tabs are active in their windows.

attention.description: Whether the tabs are drawing attention.

highlighted.description: Whether the tabs are highlighted.  Works as an alias of active.

currentWindow.description: Whether the tabs are in the $(topic:current-window)[current window].

lastFocusedWindow.description: Whether the tabs are in the last focused window.

status.description: Whether the tabs have completed loading.

discarded.description: True while the tabs are not loaded with content.

hidden.description: True while the tabs are hidden.

title.description: Match page titles against a pattern.

url.description: Match tabs against one or more $(topic:match_patterns)[URL patterns]. Note that fragment identifiers are not matched.

windowId.description: The ID of the parent window, or $(ref:windows.WINDOW_ID_CURRENT) for the $(topic:current-window)[current window].

windowType.description: The type of window the tabs are in.

index.description: The position of the tabs within their windows.

cookieStoreId.description: The CookieStoreId used for the tab.

openerTabId.description: The ID of the tab that opened this tab. If specified, the opener tab must be in the same window as this tab.

screen.description: True for any screen sharing, or a string to specify type of screen sharing.

camera.description: True if the tab is using the camera.

microphone.description: True if the tab is using the microphone.

functions.name: highlight
functions.description: Highlights the given tabs.

windowId.description: The window that contains the tabs.

populate.description: If true, the $(ref:windows.Window) returned will have a tabs property that contains a list of the $(ref:tabs.Tab) objects. The Tab objects only contain the url, title and favIconUrl properties if the extension's manifest file includes the "tabs" permission. If false, the $(ref:windows.Window) won't have the tabs property.

tabs.description: One or more tab indices to highlight.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: Contains details about the window whose tabs were highlighted.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Modifies the properties of a tab. Properties that are not specified in <var>updateProperties</var> are not modified.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the $(topic:current-window)[current window].

url.description: A URL to navigate the tab to.

active.description: Whether the tab should be active. Does not affect whether the window is focused (see $(ref:windows.update)).

highlighted.description: Adds or removes the tab from the current selection.

selected.description: Whether the tab should be selected.

pinned.description: Whether the tab should be pinned.

muted.description: Whether the tab should be muted.

openerTabId.description: The ID of the tab that opened this tab. If specified, the opener tab must be in the same window as this tab.

loadReplace.description: Whether the load should replace the current history entry for the tab.

successorTabId.description: The ID of this tab's successor. If specified, the successor tab must be in the same window as this tab.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Details about the updated tab. The $(ref:tabs.Tab) object doesn't contain url, title and favIconUrl if the "tabs" permission has not been requested.

functions.name: move
functions.description: Moves one or more tabs to a new position within its window, or to a new window. Note that tabs can only be moved to and from normal (window.type === "normal") windows.

parameters.name: tabIds
parameters.description: The tab or list of tabs to move.

windowId.description: Defaults to the window the tab is currently in.

index.description: The position to move the window to. -1 will place the tab at the end of the window.

parameters.name: tabs
parameters.description: Details about the moved tabs.

functions.name: reload
functions.description: Reload a tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to reload; defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

bypassCache.description: Whether using any local cache. Default is false.

functions.name: warmup
functions.description: Warm up a tab

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to warm up.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Closes one or more tabs.

parameters.name: tabIds
parameters.description: The tab or list of tabs to close.

functions.name: discard
functions.description: discards one or more tabs.

parameters.name: tabIds
parameters.description: The tab or list of tabs to discard.

functions.name: detectLanguage
functions.description: Detects the primary language of the content in a tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: Defaults to the active tab of the $(topic:current-window)[current window].

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: An ISO language code such as en or fr. For a complete list of languages supported by this method, see kLanguageInfoTable. The 2nd to 4th columns will be checked and the first non-NULL value will be returned except for Simplified Chinese for which zh-CN will be returned. For an unknown language, und will be returned.

functions.name: toggleReaderMode
functions.description: Toggles reader mode for the document in the tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: Defaults to the active tab of the $(topic:current-window)[current window].

functions.name: captureTab
functions.description: Captures an area of a specified tab. You must have $(topic:declare_permissions)[<all_urls>] permission to use this method.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The tab to capture. Defaults to the active tab of the current window.

functions.name: captureVisibleTab
functions.description: Captures an area of the currently active tab in the specified window. You must have $(topic:declare_permissions)[<all_urls>] permission to use this method.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: The target window. Defaults to the $(topic:current-window)[current window].

parameters.name: dataUrl
parameters.description: A data URL which encodes an image of the visible area of the captured tab. May be assigned to the 'src' property of an HTML Image element for display.

functions.name: executeScript
functions.description: Injects JavaScript code into a page. For details, see the $(topic:content_scripts)[programmatic injection] section of the content scripts doc.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab in which to run the script; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the script to run.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after all the JavaScript has been executed.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: The result of the script in every injected frame.

functions.name: insertCSS
functions.description: Injects CSS into a page. For details, see the $(topic:content_scripts)[programmatic injection] section of the content scripts doc.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab in which to insert the CSS; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the CSS text to insert.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when all the CSS has been inserted.

functions.name: removeCSS
functions.description: Removes injected CSS from a page. For details, see the $(topic:content_scripts)[programmatic injection] section of the content scripts doc.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab from which to remove the injected CSS; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the CSS text to remove.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when all the CSS has been removed.

functions.name: setZoom
functions.description: Zooms a specified tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to zoom; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: zoomFactor
parameters.description: The new zoom factor. Use a value of 0 here to set the tab to its current default zoom factor. Values greater than zero specify a (possibly non-default) zoom factor for the tab.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after the zoom factor has been changed.

functions.name: getZoom
functions.description: Gets the current zoom factor of a specified tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to get the current zoom factor from; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called with the tab's current zoom factor after it has been fetched.

parameters.name: zoomFactor
parameters.description: The tab's current zoom factor.

functions.name: setZoomSettings
functions.description: Sets the zoom settings for a specified tab, which define how zoom changes are handled. These settings are reset to defaults upon navigating the tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to change the zoom settings for; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: zoomSettings
parameters.description: Defines how zoom changes are handled and at what scope.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after the zoom settings have been changed.

functions.name: getZoomSettings
functions.description: Gets the current zoom settings of a specified tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to get the current zoom settings from; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called with the tab's current zoom settings.

parameters.name: zoomSettings
parameters.description: The tab's current zoom settings.

functions.name: print
functions.description: Prints page in active tab.

functions.name: printPreview
functions.description: Shows print preview for page in active tab.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after print preview entered.

functions.name: saveAsPDF
functions.description: Saves page in active tab as a PDF file.

parameters.name: pageSettings
parameters.description: The page settings used to save the PDF file.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after save as dialog closed.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Save status: saved, replaced, canceled, not_saved, not_replaced.

functions.name: show
functions.description: Shows one or more tabs.

parameters.name: tabIds
parameters.description: The TAB ID or list of TAB IDs to show.

functions.name: hide
functions.description: Hides one or more tabs. The "tabHide" permission is required to hide tabs. Not all tabs are hidable. Returns an array of hidden tabs.

parameters.name: tabIds
parameters.description: The TAB ID or list of TAB IDs to hide.

functions.name: moveInSuccession
functions.description: Removes an array of tabs from their lines of succession and prepends or appends them in a chain to another tab.

parameters.name: tabIds
parameters.description: An array of tab IDs to move in the line of succession. For each tab in the array, the tab's current predecessors will have their successor set to the tab's current successor, and each tab will then be set to be the successor of the previous tab in the array. Any tabs not in the same window as the tab indicated by the second argument (or the first tab in the array, if no second argument) will be skipped.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of a tab to set as the successor of the last tab in the array, or $(ref:tabs.TAB_ID_NONE) to leave the last tab without a successor. If options.append is true, then this tab is made the predecessor of the first tab in the array instead.

append.description: Whether to move the tabs before (false) or after (true) tabId in the succession. Defaults to false.

insert.description: Whether to link up the current predecessors or successor (depending on options.append) of tabId to the other side of the chain after it is prepended or appended. If true, one of the following happens: if options.append is false, the first tab in the array is set as the successor of any current predecessors of tabId; if options.append is true, the current successor of tabId is set as the successor of the last tab in the array. Defaults to false.

description: Contains types used by other schemas.

types.description:
The scope of the Setting. One of
  • regular: setting for the regular profile (which is inherited by the incognito profile if not overridden elsewhere),
  • regular_only: setting for the regular profile only (not inherited by the incognito profile),
  • incognito_persistent: setting for the incognito profile that survives browser restarts (overrides regular preferences),
  • incognito_session_only: setting for the incognito profile that can only be set during an incognito session and is deleted when the incognito session ends (overrides regular and incognito_persistent preferences).
Only regular is supported by Firefox at this time.

One of
  • not_controllable: cannot be controlled by any extension
  • controlled_by_other_extensions: controlled by extensions with higher precedence
  • controllable_by_this_extension: can be controlled by this extension
  • controlled_by_this_extension: controlled by this extension

Whether the effective value is specific to the incognito session.
This property will only be present if the incognito property in the details parameter of get() was true.

The value of the setting.
Note that every setting has a specific value type, which is described together with the setting. An extension should not set a value of a different type.

Whether the value that has changed is specific to the incognito session.
This property will only be present if the user has enabled the extension in incognito mode.

description: Use the browser.webRequest API to observe and analyze traffic and to intercept, block, or modify requests in-flight.

MAX_HANDLER_BEHAVIOR_CHANGED_CALLS_PER_1.description: The maximum number of times that handlerBehaviorChanged can be called per 10 minute sustained interval. handlerBehaviorChanged is an expensive function call that shouldn't be called often.

types.description: An object describing filters to apply to webRequest events.

urls.description: A list of URLs or URL patterns. Requests that cannot match any of the URLs will be filtered out.

types.description: A list of request types. Requests that cannot match any of the types will be filtered out.

incognito.description: If provided, requests that do not match the incognito state will be filtered out.

types.description: An array of HTTP headers. Each header is represented as a dictionary containing the keys name and either value or binaryValue.

value.description: Value of the HTTP header if it can be represented by UTF-8.

binaryValue.description: Value of the HTTP header if it cannot be represented by UTF-8, stored as individual byte values (0..255).

types.description: Returns value for event handlers that have the 'blocking' extraInfoSpec applied. Allows the event handler to modify network requests.

cancel.description: If true, the request is cancelled. Used in onBeforeRequest, this prevents the request from being sent.

redirectUrl.description: Only used as a response to the onBeforeRequest and onHeadersReceived events. If set, the original request is prevented from being sent/completed and is instead redirected to the given URL. Redirections to non-HTTP schemes such as data: are allowed. Redirects initiated by a redirect action use the original request method for the redirect, with one exception: If the redirect is initiated at the onHeadersReceived stage, then the redirect will be issued using the GET method.

upgradeToSecure.description: Only used as a response to the onBeforeRequest event. If set, the original request is prevented from being sent/completed and is instead upgraded to a secure request. If any extension returns redirectUrl during onBeforeRequest, upgradeToSecure will have no affect.

requestHeaders.description: Only used as a response to the onBeforeSendHeaders event. If set, the request is made with these request headers instead.

responseHeaders.description: Only used as a response to the onHeadersReceived event. If set, the server is assumed to have responded with these response headers instead. Only return responseHeaders if you really want to modify the headers in order to limit the number of conflicts (only one extension may modify responseHeaders for each request).

authCredentials.description: Only used as a response to the onAuthRequired event. If set, the request is made using the supplied credentials.

types.description: Contains the certificate properties of the request if it is a secure request.
Contains the security properties of the request (ie. SSL/TLS information).

cipherSuite.description: The cipher suite used in this request if state is "secure".

keaGroupName.description: The key exchange algorithm used in this request if state is "secure".

signatureSchemeName.description: The signature scheme used in this request if state is "secure".

certificates.description: Certificate data if state is "secure". Will only contain one entry unless certificateChain is passed as an option.

isDomainMismatch.description: The domain name does not match the certificate domain.

isNotValidAtThisTime.description: The certificate is either expired or is not yet valid. See CertificateInfo.validity for start and end dates.

certificateTransparencyStatus.description: Certificate transparency compliance per RFC 6962. See https://www.certificate-transparency.org/what-is-ct for more information.

hsts.description: True if host uses Strict Transport Security and state is "secure".

hpkp.description: True if host uses Public Key Pinning and state is "secure".

weaknessReasons.description: list of reasons that cause the request to be considered weak, if state is "weak"

bytes.description: An ArrayBuffer with a copy of the data.

file.description: A string with the file's path and name.

types.description: Contains data uploaded in a URL request.
Tracking flags that match our internal tracking classification
If the request has been classified this is an array of $(ref:UrlClassificationFlags).

firstParty.description: Classification flags if the request has been classified and it is first party.

thirdParty.description: Classification flags if the request has been classified and it or its window hierarchy is third party.

If the data is of another media type, or if it is malformed, the dictionary is not present. An example value of this dictionary is {'key': ['value1', 'value2']}.

description: Use the browser.windows API to interact with browser windows. You can use this API to create, modify, and rearrange windows in the browser.

types.description: The type of browser window this is. Under some circumstances a Window may not be assigned type property, for example when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.
The state of this browser window. Under some circumstances a Window may not be assigned state property, for example when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

id.description: The ID of the window. Window IDs are unique within a browser session. Under some circumstances a Window may not be assigned an ID, for example when querying windows using the $(ref:sessions) API, in which case a session ID may be present.

focused.description: Whether the window is currently the focused window.

top.description: The offset of the window from the top edge of the screen in pixels. Under some circumstances a Window may not be assigned top property, for example when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

left.description: The offset of the window from the left edge of the screen in pixels. Under some circumstances a Window may not be assigned left property, for example when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

width.description: The width of the window, including the frame, in pixels. Under some circumstances a Window may not be assigned width property, for example when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

height.description: The height of the window, including the frame, in pixels. Under some circumstances a Window may not be assigned height property, for example when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

tabs.description: Array of $(ref:tabs.Tab) objects representing the current tabs in the window.

type.description: The type of browser window this is.

state.description: The state of this browser window.

alwaysOnTop.description: Whether the window is set to be always on top.

sessionId.description: The session ID used to uniquely identify a Window obtained from the $(ref:sessions) API.

title.description: The title of the window. Read-only.

types.description: Specifies what type of browser window to create. The 'panel' and 'detached_panel' types create a popup unless the '--enable-panels' flag is set.
Specifies whether the $(ref:windows.Window) returned should contain a list of the $(ref:tabs.Tab) objects.

populate.description: If true, the $(ref:windows.Window) returned will have a tabs property that contains a list of the $(ref:tabs.Tab) objects. The Tab objects only contain the url, title and favIconUrl properties if the extension's manifest file includes the "tabs" permission.

windowTypes.description: windowTypes is deprecated and ignored on Firefox.

WINDOW_ID_NONE.description: The windowId value that represents the absence of a browser window.

WINDOW_ID_CURRENT.description: The windowId value that represents the $(topic:current-window)[current window].

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets details about a window.

functions.name: getCurrent
functions.description: Gets the $(topic:current-window)[current window].

functions.name: getLastFocused
functions.description: Gets the window that was most recently focused — typically the window 'on top'.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Gets all windows.

parameters.name: getInfo
parameters.description: Specifies properties used to filter the $(ref:windows.Window) returned and to determine whether they should contain a list of the $(ref:tabs.Tab) objects.

windowTypes.description: If set, the $(ref:windows.Window) returned will be filtered based on its type. If unset the default filter is set to ['app', 'normal', 'panel', 'popup'], with 'app' and 'panel' window types limited to the extension's own windows.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates (opens) a new browser with any optional sizing, position or default URL provided.

url.description: A URL or array of URLs to open as tabs in the window. Fully-qualified URLs must include a scheme (i.e. 'http://www.google.com', not 'www.google.com'). Relative URLs will be relative to the current page within the extension. Defaults to the New Tab Page.

tabId.description: The id of the tab for which you want to adopt to the new window.

left.description: The number of pixels to position the new window from the left edge of the screen. If not specified, the new window is offset naturally from the last focused window. This value is ignored for panels.

top.description: The number of pixels to position the new window from the top edge of the screen. If not specified, the new window is offset naturally from the last focused window. This value is ignored for panels.

width.description: The width in pixels of the new window, including the frame. If not specified defaults to a natural width.

height.description: The height in pixels of the new window, including the frame. If not specified defaults to a natural height.

focused.description: If true, opens an active window. If false, opens an inactive window.

incognito.description: Whether the new window should be an incognito window.

type.description: Specifies what type of browser window to create. The 'panel' and 'detached_panel' types create a popup unless the '--enable-panels' flag is set.

state.description: The initial state of the window. The 'minimized', 'maximized' and 'fullscreen' states cannot be combined with 'left', 'top', 'width' or 'height'.

allowScriptsToClose.description: Allow scripts to close the window.

cookieStoreId.description: The CookieStoreId to use for all tabs that were created when the window is opened.

titlePreface.description: A string to add to the beginning of the window title.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: Contains details about the created window.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Updates the properties of a window. Specify only the properties that you want to change; unspecified properties will be left unchanged.

left.description: The offset from the left edge of the screen to move the window to in pixels. This value is ignored for panels.

top.description: The offset from the top edge of the screen to move the window to in pixels. This value is ignored for panels.

width.description: The width to resize the window to in pixels. This value is ignored for panels.

height.description: The height to resize the window to in pixels. This value is ignored for panels.

focused.description: If true, brings the window to the front. If false, brings the next window in the z-order to the front.

drawAttention.description: If true, causes the window to be displayed in a manner that draws the user's attention to the window, without changing the focused window. The effect lasts until the user changes focus to the window. This option has no effect if the window already has focus. Set to false to cancel a previous draw attention request.

state.description: The new state of the window. The 'minimized', 'maximized' and 'fullscreen' states cannot be combined with 'left', 'top', 'width' or 'height'.

titlePreface.description: A string to add to the beginning of the window title.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes (closes) a window, and all the tabs inside it.

events.name: onCreated
events.description: Fired when a window is created.

filters.name: windowTypes
filters.description: Conditions that the window's type being created must satisfy. By default it will satisfy ['app', 'normal', 'panel', 'popup'], with 'app' and 'panel' window types limited to the extension's own windows.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: Details of the window that was created.

events.name: onRemoved
events.description: Fired when a window is removed (closed).

filters.name: windowTypes
filters.description: Conditions that the window's type being removed must satisfy. By default it will satisfy ['app', 'normal', 'panel', 'popup'], with 'app' and 'panel' window types limited to the extension's own windows.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: ID of the removed window.

events.name: onFocusChanged
events.description: Fired when the currently focused window changes. Will be $(ref:windows.WINDOW_ID_NONE) if all browser windows have lost focus. Note: On some Linux window managers, WINDOW_ID_NONE will always be sent immediately preceding a switch from one browser window to another.

filters.name: windowTypes
filters.description: Conditions that the window's type being removed must satisfy. By default it will satisfy ['app', 'normal', 'panel', 'popup'], with 'app' and 'panel' window types limited to the extension's own windows.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: ID of the newly focused window.
